intro: Taraxacum mirum, commonly known as the fairy dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its delicate, yellow flower heads that resemble miniature sunflowers, which bloom in early spring. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves that are hairy and deeply lobed, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Taraxacum mirum is a perennial plant that is often found in temperate regions across Europe and parts of Asia.
